item.title: The Other Place
item.dc:creator: Mary Gaitskill
item.description: My son, Douglas, loves to play with toy guns. He is thirteen. He loves video games in which people get killed.

item.title: Mirrorball
item.dc:creator: Mary Gaitskill
item.description: He took her soul—though, being a secular-minded person, he didn’t think of it that way.

item.title: The Devil's Treasure
item.dc:creator: Mary Gaitskill
item.description: To read this story, become a Electric Literature member

item.title: Something Better Than This
item.dc:creator: Mary Gaitskill
item.description: It's one of those raw, wrung out Yonge Street Saturday mornings. The smog-gray sky is just congealing into blue over the buildings and concrete.

item.title: What Men Talk About When They Talk About Mary Gaitskill
item.dc:creator: Mary Gaitskill
item.description: I hate it when men talk about Mary Gaitskill. I call for a permanent moratorium on men gassily discoursing on Mary Gaitskill.

item.title: Wish Fulfillment
item.dc:creator: Mary Gaitskill
item.description: One night Mary, a little girl with sisters and parents who loved her, woke in a dark forest.

item.title: Mary Gaitskill [interview]
item.dc:creator: Stephen Westfall
item.description: Mary Gaitskill’s collection of short stories, Bad Behavior, has a curious history.

item.title: Because They Wanted To
item.dc:creator: Mary Gaitskill
item.description: He lay in his reclining chair, barely awake enough to feel the dream moving just under his thoughts.
